releases.title: CHICKEN WITH It's HEAD CUT OFF

content: Teaming up with Montreal powerhouse Yung Kang Ra, MIM AL has delivered one of his most ambitious collaborations to date. This track pushes beyond genres, fusing the raw aggression of metal with the grit and swagger of hip hop. Yung Kang Ra's explosive vocals and razor-sharp lyricism cut through heavy guitar riffs and pounding drums, while MIM AL grounds the chaos with a bold, unflinching vision. The result is a song that refuses to be ignored—loud, intense, and unapologetically alive.

The song itself is a whirlwind of emotions: rage, defiance, self-reflection, and relentless energy. From the primal hook repeating "fucked up, lucked out" to verses that explore the highs of ambition and the lows of destructive cycles, it captures the chaos of modern life with brutal honesty. Adding to the chaos is a blazing guitar solo and an unexpected yet powerful saxophone performance by Nathan Bissonette, giving the track an edge that's both chaotic and strangely elegant.

For MIM AL, this release marks a turning point. Stepping outside of his comfort zone, he's proven his ability to blur lines between genres and carve out his own sonic identity. It's more than just a collaboration—it's a statement piece. With Yung Kang Ra by his side, MIM AL has created a track that not only showcases his evolution as an artist but also sets a new standard for the kind of fearless, genre-breaking music coming out of Montreal's underground scene.
blog.inspiration: Lyrics for CHICKEN WITH It's HEAD CUT OFF
blog.recordingNotes: The majority of the track was recorded at the legendary Breakglass Studio in Montreal, where MIM AL and Yung Kang Ra laid down the foundation of the song. With the expertise of engineer Jalil Khayat guiding the sessions, every layer of sound was captured with precision. The final mix and master were handled by Daniel Sultarz, whose touch elevated the track into the explosive, polished masterpiece it became.

releases.title: Not So Special
releases.description: A raw exploration of feeling ordinary in an extraordinary world

content: In a world of complex compositions, 'Not So Special' finds beauty in simplicity. This instrumental track emerged from late-night studio sessions where the guitar became a voice for unspoken emotions.
The opening melody came to me during one of those quiet moments of reflection. Each note carries the weight of introspection, creating an ambient soundscape that speaks without words.
This piece explores the concept that not everything needs to be extraordinary to be meaningful. Sometimes the most profound statements come from the gentlest touches on the strings.
The recording captures the raw, intimate moments between artist and instrument. Every sustain, every gentle bend tells part of the story of finding peace in being authentically yourself.
This track represents the core of what Mim Al's instrumental journey is about: guitar music that doesn't need lyrics to communicate deep emotional truths.
blog.inspiration: Written during a period of embracing minimalism and finding beauty in simple, honest guitar melodies.
blog.recordingNotes: Recorded in a single take using a clean Telecaster through a warm tube amp, capturing the natural room acoustics.

releases.title: Dim Out the Lights
releases.description: When darkness becomes your comfort zone

content: There's something magical about music in low light. 'Dim Out the Lights' was born from that intimate space where guitar and atmosphere merge into something ethereal.

This instrumental track explores the sonic territory between ambient and melodic guitar work. The piece moves through different emotional landscapes, all painted with careful note choices and atmospheric textures.
The guitar work shifts between clean, crystalline tones and warm, saturated passages. It's the musical equivalent of watching shadows dance on the wall - familiar yet mysterious.
What started as a simple chord progression became an exploration of space and silence. The pauses between notes are as important as the notes themselves, creating a breathing, living composition.
This track showcases the more ambient side of instrumental guitar, where melody serves emotion rather than technical display.
blog.inspiration: Written during a period of embracing minimalism and finding beauty in simple, honest guitar melodies.
blog.recordingNotes: Recorded in a single take using a clean Telecaster through a warm tube amp, capturing the natural room acoustics.

releases.title: NoCebo
releases.description: Contemplative instrumental exploring the power of musical healing

content: Music often carries a therapeutic quality, and NoCebo leans into that idea through gentle, restrained guitar work. The title plays on the opposite of placebo—the belief that something might harm when it actually helps—challenging listeners to reconsider their expectations.

What might at first sound melancholic gradually unfolds into something more hopeful, revealing layers of resolution for those willing to sit with it. Each note, bend, and sustain is placed with intent, prioritizing emotional weight over technical showmanship.
This track came together as a collaborative effort:
- LOOWI contributed an expressive and soulful keyboard solo.
- MYIASIS (Germany) laid down the drums, giving the piece its heartbeat.
- Menflou handled production, mixing, and mastering, bringing everything into balance.
At its core, NoCebo is a reflection on vulnerability as strength—the idea that honest musical expression can be both healing for the listener and cathartic for the creator.
blog.inspiration: Written during a period of personal reflection on the healing power of music and the importance of emotional honesty in art.
blog.recordingNotes: Recorded with a focus on natural dynamics and authentic performance, using minimal processing to preserve the raw emotional content.

releases.title: Sudden Confusion
releases.description: Navigating the chaos of creative uncertainty

content: Sometimes the best music comes from moments of complete uncertainty. 'Sudden Confusion' captures that feeling when you're lost in the creative process but somehow find your way through.
This track started as a simple riff that refused to resolve. Instead of fighting it, I leaned into the dissonance and let it guide the composition.
The guitar work here is deliberately chaotic - bending notes that don't quite fit, creating tension that never fully resolves. It's uncomfortable, but intentionally so.

What makes this track special is how it embraces the messiness of creativity. Not every musical idea needs to be polished or perfect - sometimes the raw, unfinished quality is exactly what it needs to be.
This piece represents a different side of instrumental guitar - one that's willing to explore the uncomfortable spaces between certainty and doubt.
blog.inspiration: Written during a period of creative uncertainty and self-doubt, this track explores the beauty in embracing the unknown.
blog.recordingNotes: Recorded in a single take to preserve the raw, unfiltered emotion of the moment.

releases.title: Contrast in May
releases.description: The beauty found in life's contradictions

content: May is a month of contrasts - the last of spring's uncertainty mixed with the promise of summer's warmth. This track explores those moments when life feels both beautiful and bittersweet.
The composition moves between major and minor tonalities, creating a sense of emotional complexity that mirrors the transitional nature of the season.
Each section of the piece represents a different aspect of this contrast - the hopeful melodies against the melancholic harmonies, the bright tones against the darker textures.
What started as a simple exploration of seasonal change became a meditation on the dualities we all experience - joy and sorrow, hope and doubt, certainty and confusion.
This track showcases the storytelling power of instrumental music, where emotion is conveyed through the careful balance of light and shadow.
blog.inspiration: Written during the transitional month of May, exploring the contrasts between hope and uncertainty.
blog.recordingNotes: Recorded with a focus on capturing the emotional complexity of the season through careful tonal choices.

releases.title: Bleeze
releases.description: A gentle breeze of musical inspiration

content: Sometimes the most powerful music comes from the gentlest moments. 'Bleeze' captures that feeling of a soft breeze carrying inspiration through an open window.
This track is built around a simple, repeating melody that evolves gradually. Each repetition adds subtle variations, creating a sense of movement and growth.
The guitar work here is intentionally understated - clean tones, gentle dynamics, and plenty of space between notes. It's about what's not played as much as what is.
What makes this piece special is its patience. It doesn't rush to get anywhere, instead allowing the listener to settle into its gentle rhythm and flow.
This track represents the meditative side of instrumental guitar - music that invites contemplation rather than demands attention.
blog.inspiration: Written during a quiet morning when a gentle breeze brought a moment of clarity and inspiration.
blog.recordingNotes: Recorded with minimal processing to preserve the natural, organic quality of the performance.

about.heading: About MIM AL
paragraphs: Behind MIM AL lives MimTheHuman—the authentic voice that refuses to settle for surface-level art.
Mim Al is a Bangladeshi-Canadian guitarist, singer-songwriter, and producer known for crafting dynamic indie rock, math rock, midwest emo, and alternative rock compositions that push boundaries.
